Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Patch Set 7:

I'm a bit confused by the concept of RPC-over-HTTP, why not just use a plain ol' REST API? 

(I suspect calling a mechanism "RPC", but which is not RPC-over-AMQP in the traditional openstack sense, would cause confusion ...)

Cheers,
Eoghan

Patch Set 7:

Hey Eoghan,

Just like v1, this API is meant to be used by glance-api and not exposed to the outside world. The difference is that it is meant to be used by a registry-db-driver[0]. The idea is to make it easier to implement new methods to the database API without having to modify the registry's API.

The benefits of doing so are: 

1) it reduces the places where things need to be modified when implementing new features in the DB side,

2) It reduces duplicated code

3) This will help migrating Glance's API v1 to use the database driver, which will allow users using glance-api v1 to deprecate the registry if they whish so.

The reason why an message broker was not used is that it doesn't make sense to add more dependencies (like MB, libraries) for this feature that is suposed to be kept simple. However, there are some queued blueprints that might require having a MB in glance, if that happens, we could definitely consider replacing RPC-over-HTTP with something based on that.

Does that makes sense?

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/registry-db-driver
